body:
It appears that the compilePath function is at fault:

https://github.com/ReactTraining/react-router/blob/262b45dd8d6cbdc3a984259c5591ffc3de80d600/packages/react-router/index.tsx#L999

`<Route path="/app/*" ... />` is compiling down to the RegExp match pattern: `^(/app)\/?(.*)$`

This is causing `matchPath('/app/*', '/apples')` to match.

Incidentally, this also means that `matchPath('/app', '/app?editing=true')` **doesn't** match which makes little sense as search params shouldn't affect whether a route is matched.

This seems (possibly??) only to apply to Routes at the "root" level and not descendant or nested routes.

A more useful RegExp pattern for compilePath to resolve to in the case of `/app/*` would be `^(\/app)(\/.*|\?.*)?$`

I'm not familiar enough with the inner workings of compilePath to submit a PR but perhaps this help to isolate the problem.

I, for one, am eagerly waiting for this to be fixed.

issue.title: [v6]`matchPath` ignores ending slash
issue.body:
<!--
Thank you for contributing!

Have a usage question?
======================
The issue tracker is meant for bug reports only. This isn't the best place for usage questions. Questions here don't have as much visibility as they do elsewhere. Before you ask a question, here are some resources to get help first:

- Read the docs: https://reacttraining.com/react-router
- Check out the list of frequently asked questions: https://github.com/ReactTraining/react-router/blob/master/FAQ.md
- Explore examples: https://reacttraining.com/react-router/web/example/basic
- Look for/ask questions on Stack Overflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=react-router
- Ask in chat: https://discord.gg/0ZcbPKXt5bYaNQ46

Think you found a bug?
======================
The best bug report is a failing test in the repository as a pull request. Otherwise, please use the "BUG REPORT" template below.

Have a feature request?
=======================
Remove the template from below and provide thoughtful commentary *and code samples* on what this feature means for your product. What will it allow you to do that you can't do today? How will it make current work-arounds straightforward? What potential bugs and edge cases does it help to avoid? etc. Please keep it product-centric.
-->

<!-- BUG TEMPLATE -->

## Version

**6.0.0-beta.0**

## Test Case

https://codesandbox.io/s/matchpath-example-9299d

## Steps to reproduce

Call `matchPath("foo/*", "/foo-bar/one")`

## Expected Behavior

I think `/foo-bar/one` shouldn't be a match for `foo/*`, thus the return should be `null`.

## Actual Behavior

The return is
```
path: "foo/*"
pathname: "/foo"
params: Object
  *: "-bar/one"
```

issue.title: [v6] <NavLink> is matching parts of words
issue.body:
## Version

**v6.0.0-beta.0**

## Test Case

https://codesandbox.io/s/kind-margulis-9n81x?file=/src/App.js

## Steps to reproduce

In the sandbox above, navigate to /hamburger

## Expected Behavior

The `<NavLink />` should apply the `activeClassName` on the /hamburger link, but not the /ham link.

## Actual Behavior

It applies the `activeClassName` to both /ham and /hamburger when we are on /hamburger.

This is not what you'd expect, and not what's happening in v5 - see https://codesandbox.io/s/strange-platform-zythu?file=/src/App.js for the v5 behaviour.

You can add the `fresh` label to prevent me from taking any action.
Hi React Router team. We are using the new awesome v6-beta on quite large apps and we have started seeing this issue as well. Any updates would be appreciated
I'm having a similar issue with `NavLink`. Links are active for incorrect pages. For example, `/foo/1` would be active on `/foo/12`, `/foo/13` etc.

issue.title: [v6] Route path matching is not intuitive: take "apple/applet" as an example
issue.body:
## Version 6.0.0-beta.0 ## Test Case https://codesandbox.io/s/react-router-v6-fhefl ## Steps to reproduce In the sandbox above, click on the `Apple` and `Applet` link. ## Expected Behavior When I click on the `Applet` link, I hope it could redirect to `NotFoundPage`, not `ApplePage`. ## Actual Behavior When I click on the `Applet` link, it redirects to `ApplePage`. The behavior is not intuitive. ## Extra ```jsx import React from "react"; import { BrowserRouter, Routes, Route, Navigate, Link } from "react-router-dom"; function HomePage() { return
Page
; } function NotFoundPage() { return
Page
; } function ApplePage() { return
Page
; } export default function App() { return (
Home Apple Applet Test
} /> } /> } /> } /> } /> ); } ```

issue.title: [v6]: Unexpected behavior of useMatch() hook
issue.body:
### What version of React Router are you using?

6

### Steps to Reproduce

Hello, I noticed unusual behavior while using useMatch hook.

### Expected Behavior

for example, useMatch ("/ about") should be matched when the URL is /about, which works as well as version five, but behaves differently when it is useMatch ("/ a / *"). Surprisingly, it matches again!!
I do not know if this is a bug or if useMatch is supposed to behave differently in version 6.

### Actual Behavior

 Here is code sandbox for more information : 
https://codesandbox.io/s/react-router-basic-forked-ou8c3?file=/example.js
 checkout log when route is /about.

body:
there is a lot of errors in this package we are facing a lot of issues,

for example 

/search
/:publication

/search?q=query+string

is matching when go to the route from other route publication route.

is like 2 years this version, we appreciate if this can be fix soon.

thanks for the work.
Fixed in #7874, release coming this week!

nice!!!!!!
